name: Monopar Therapeutics Inc.
description: Monopar Therapeutics Inc. is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to developing innovative therapies for cancer patients. Founded in 2017, Monopar focuses on advancing unique drug candidates derived from its proprietary technology platform aimed at treating various cancer indications. The company's lead product candidate, MNPR-202, is being evaluated for its potential to enhance the efficacy of chemotherapy while minimizing side effects, thus improving the quality of life for cancer patients. Monopar's approach is rooted in a strong commitment to transforming cancer care through scientific rigor and a patient-centric philosophy. The company collaborates with leading research institutions and clinical centers to foster innovation and accelerate the development of new therapies. By leveraging advancements in drug delivery and targeting mechanisms, Monopar aims to address significant unmet medical needs in oncology, positioning itself as a key player in the fight against cancer.
ceo: Charles J. W. S. S. M. L. L. K. K. T. G. H. M. H. V. O. P. D. R. A. D. H. C. A. D. S. B. M. R. A. J.

seo.meta_title: Monopar Therapeutics Inc. | Innovative Cancer Therapies
seo.meta_description: Explore Monopar Therapeutics Inc., a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on developing innovative therapies for cancer patients. Learn about our commitment to improving cancer care.

faq.question: What is Monopar Therapeutics known for?
faq.answer: Monopar Therapeutics is known for developing innovative therapies aimed at improving cancer treatment and patient quality of life.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Monopar Therapeutics?
faq.answer: Charles J. W. S. S. M. L. L. K. K. T. G. H. M. H. V. O. P. D. R. A. D. H. C. A. D. S. B. M. R. A. J. is the CEO of Monopar Therapeutics Inc.

faq.question: Where is Monopar headquartered?
faq.answer: Monopar is headquartered in Skokie, Illinois, USA.

faq.question: What is Monopar's lead product candidate?
faq.answer: Monopar's lead product candidate is MNPR-202, intended for enhancing chemotherapy efficacy.
